cheatsheet.title: Generate C++ Code from UML/Alf class model

intro.description: This cheat sheet describes how structural and behavioral C++ code can be generated from an object-oriented UML model, where bodies of operations are specified using the Alf textual syntax.

item.title: Configure the UML/Alf to C++ code generator
item.description: First of all, the target folders for code generation must be configured.

subitem.label: Go to menu Window / Preferences / Papyrus / UML/Alf to C++ Code Generator
Select the target rool folder for code generation (By default, the rule for generation is Use folder of the target UML model as root).
Specify a path relative to the root (e.g. src-gen/cppCode), press Apply, and finally OK.

item.title: Generate code from a UML model
item.description: Once the UML/Alf to C++ code generator has been configured, code generation can be applied from a UML model.

subitem.label: In the project explorer, select the .uml file from which you want to generate code
Right-click, press C++ code generation, and finally Generate C++ code from UML/Alf class model.
